channel.title: [TUT] Staying connected through linux using IRSSI
channel.description:
[b]Other places posted: (My Forums): http://www.guruforums.net/thread-35.html[/b]
[b]Tested On[/b] uBuntu and CentOS [b]Programs Downloaded/Used[/b] Irssi, Screen, SSH Client
[b]Note:[/b] Most shells already have Irssi, Screen
Step 1, Sign into your SSH.
[img]http://img532.imageshack.us/img532/54/step1p.png[/img]
Step 2, ubuntu: [code]apt-get install irssi[/code] CentOS: [code]yum install irssi[/code] Example: [img]http://img213.imageshack.us/img213/4788/88548036.png[/img]
Step 3. ubuntu: [code]apt-get install screen[/code] CentOS: [code]yum install screen[/code] Example: [img]http://img265.imageshack.us/img265/1466/82790418.png[/img]
After both those packages are installed type the following:
[code]screen[/code]
followed by:
[code]irssi[/code]
[img]http://img686.imageshack.us/img686/2391/81025746.png[/img]
and it will connect, if you want to keep it on while the SSH is closed, use control + A and then type d, it will detatch, if you get back on the shell and want to reopen it, type screen -r "r" for resume.
